Corpus examples –
[...] ’Se glé bheag de chobhair a thug a’ Phàrlamaid a riamh do ’n Ghàidhlig no do fhoghlum agus do litreachas na Gàidhlig. [...] Dé na rudan a dh’ fhaodadh sinn iarraidh? [...] Chan eil an sin ach rud no dhà a dh’ fhaodamaid iarraidh. Tha Comunn nan Croitearan air nì de ’n t-seòrsa so iarraidh mar tha, air a’ Bh.B.C. Thug sin togail inntinn dhuinn. Có a nis a chuireas fead chruaidh ann an cluais Luchd an Ionmhais ann a Westminster?
[...] The Parliament has given very little assistance ever to the Gaelic language or to Gaelic education and literature. [...] What are the things that we could demand? [...] Those are just a couple of things that we could demand. The Crofters’ Society has demanded something of this kind already, on the BBC. That has given us inspiration. Who now will put a hard whistle [?] in the ear of the Finance People in Westminster? td. 105, ‘Air an Spiris’
Tha An Comunn Gaidhealach a’ bruidhinn air Seanaileir ùr a thaghadh a bhios os cionn obair a’ Chomuinn. [...] Cha b’ fhuilear do dhuine de ’n t-seòrsa so tomhas mhath de chumhachd a bhith aige. [...] Bhiodh a leòr aige ri dhèanamh an toiseach ag ath-nuadhachadh dreach a’ Chomuinn. Tha móran ri dhèanamh ris a’ Mhòd mus beir e air linn an telebhisean, no eadhon air linn an réidio: bu mhath gun cuirte luchd-sgrìobhaidh is luchd-ciùil an sàs ann a bhith a’ cruthachadh ás ùr, an àite bhith an còmhnaidh a’ cur seòrsa de dhreach ùr air seann rudan [...] Tha sinn a’ guidhe ’s ag iarraidh gu lorg An Comunn duine de ’n t-seòrsa so.
The Highland Society is talking about choosing a new General who will oversee the Society’s work. [...] A person of this kind would have to have a good measure of power. [...] He would have enough to do initially reforming the Society. There is much to do at the Mod before it catches up with ?? the era of television, or even with the era of radio: writers and musicians should be involved in creating afresh, instead of always putting a sort of new form on old things [...] We are praying and asking that The Society will find a person of this kind. td. 105, ‘Air an Spiris’
